# 

<span key="9e09a4d3b16841e99bd1d286eb90f9c9"><span offset-key="9e09a4d3b16841e99bd1d286eb90f9c9:0">Things to do in your code</span></span>

<span key="f17115ec3a3340bfb5760f0564fd34a6"><span offset-key="f17115ec3a3340bfb5760f0564fd34a6:0">Here are some things you can do in your code to improve your application’s performance:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="814d6159549e4c08956f1a394520b8a7"><span offset-key="814d6159549e4c08956f1a394520b8a7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#use-gzip-compression" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f50074a458ee466989a6ede00ae04304" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="e8f25f5d1848465ea3ff6d335e71e3a2"><span data-offset-key="e8f25f5d1848465ea3ff6d335e71e3a2:0">Use gzip compression</span></span></span></a><span key="10aecd0dc97f4071bd95bbe58070633b"><span offset-key="10aecd0dc97f4071bd95bbe58070633b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="52380a0ba81b4683b85e1d5cb46bdf7e"><span offset-key="52380a0ba81b4683b85e1d5cb46bdf7e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#dont-use-synchronous-functions" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ba66da54d718456489eb9d49d9232f9b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="a7f28d6e92af4c9aade12f3e9b845bde"><span data-offset-key="a7f28d6e92af4c9aade12f3e9b845bde:0">Don’t use synchronous functions</span></span></span></a><span key="57e1f5faa290494d95fc78504c1fe4ee"><span offset-key="57e1f5faa290494d95fc78504c1fe4ee:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="543cf151e4a94a2e9cf4198d63c3e996"><span offset-key="543cf151e4a94a2e9cf4198d63c3e996:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#do-logging-correctly" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="96690a72d6d3492db0d135242fc95116" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="37c51c33c88043398b692b28d5709a53"><span data-offset-key="37c51c33c88043398b692b28d5709a53:0">Do logging correctly</span></span></span></a><span key="4d5c1e8f37574001a25c552a2ea05a1a"><span offset-key="4d5c1e8f37574001a25c552a2ea05a1a:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4db4f87586fd445db706873aac05b7a4"><span offset-key="4db4f87586fd445db706873aac05b7a4:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#handle-exceptions-properly" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6212b7b942594360ad4209103a05604f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="b7c008ee7dca41daa586aee057a96180"><span data-offset-key="b7c008ee7dca41daa586aee057a96180:0">Handle exceptions properly</span></span></span></a><span key="840814d79cb940118e2136a6cfcbcdf9"><span offset-key="840814d79cb940118e2136a6cfcbcdf9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="d54cb75578674a7ead1a56843f6148ee"><span offset-key="d54cb75578674a7ead1a56843f6148ee:0">Use gzip compression</span></span>

<span key="c60e7123180a41c5bc9a2a2dc4434390"><span offset-key="c60e7123180a41c5bc9a2a2dc4434390:0">Gzip compressing can greatly decrease the size of the response body and hence increase the speed of a web app. Use the </span></span><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/compression" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e3c65658fc4c4dde9ccedec395aea2a3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="e518b05b3c9f405fbeae0ec5a4e71340"><span data-offset-key="e518b05b3c9f405fbeae0ec5a4e71340:0">compression</span></span></span></a><span key="69e63e6f0c2843c887f51a5627c6ba1c"><span offset-key="69e63e6f0c2843c887f51a5627c6ba1c:0"> middleware for gzip compression in your Express app. For example:</span></span>

1

<span key="ab460b8d52714d9a93dddf8eed82b2d0"><span offset-key="ab460b8d52714d9a93dddf8eed82b2d0:0">var compression = require('compression')</span></span>

2

<span key="5051bab6037e4ac0b2f1e37597977583"><span offset-key="5051bab6037e4ac0b2f1e37597977583:0">var express = require('express')</span></span>

3

<span key="2cf5a2d4b0ad4604b50891146f537938"><span offset-key="2cf5a2d4b0ad4604b50891146f537938:0">var app = express()</span></span>

4

<span key="fe6db2c36ab3422199d10c4c329b350d"><span offset-key="fe6db2c36ab3422199d10c4c329b350d:0">app.use(compression())</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="17d89c2e07084edc9c10112ba6681099"><span offset-key="17d89c2e07084edc9c10112ba6681099:0">For a high-traffic website in production, the best way to put compression in place is to implement it at a reverse proxy level (see </span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#use-a-reverse-proxy" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="688bdd0e7c204dbe95f8e747af0290be" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="8a0fecc57f3a4880a3939822b9cac68a"><span data-offset-key="8a0fecc57f3a4880a3939822b9cac68a:0">Use a reverse proxy</span></span></span></a><span key="b321f080b6dd4062a588b1bdbae4393a"><span offset-key="b321f080b6dd4062a588b1bdbae4393a:0">). In that case, you do not need to use compression middleware. For details on enabling gzip compression in Nginx, see </span></span><a href="http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_gzip_module.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6ca3a3908f564962932f4e76f6e549e8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="09062a49c9824aa89d2486bae7327699"><span data-offset-key="09062a49c9824aa89d2486bae7327699:0">Module ngx_http_gzip_module</span></span></span></a><span key="22f24b5e36eb463a8820fd851836fc47"><span offset-key="22f24b5e36eb463a8820fd851836fc47:0"> in the Nginx documentation.</span></span>

# 

<span key="4a6f0f643c28404b8d5005639330d822"><span offset-key="4a6f0f643c28404b8d5005639330d822:0">Don’t use synchronous functions</span></span>

<span key="dca68e751604445480204e2d9f92671e"><span offset-key="dca68e751604445480204e2d9f92671e:0">Synchronous functions and methods tie up the executing process until they return. A single call to a synchronous function might return in a few microseconds or milliseconds, however in high-traffic websites, these calls add up and reduce the performance of the app. Avoid their use in production.</span></span>

<span key="dae71abb72c5427d97b7701f62aa5ce7"><span offset-key="dae71abb72c5427d97b7701f62aa5ce7:0">Although Node and many modules provide synchronous and asynchronous versions of their functions, always use the asynchronous version in production. The only time when a synchronous function can be justified is upon initial startup.</span></span>

<span key="d290a1960d244ca79d59de4280ed96c3"><span offset-key="d290a1960d244ca79d59de4280ed96c3:0">If you are using Node.js 4.0+ or io.js 2.1.0+, you can use the </span>`--trace-sync-io`<span offset-key="d290a1960d244ca79d59de4280ed96c3:2"> command-line flag to print a warning and a stack trace whenever your application uses a synchronous API. Of course, you wouldn’t want to use this in production, but rather to ensure that your code is ready for production. See the </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#cli_trace_sync_io" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="693893d4440142fdaa39fed12bb9a46e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="796db4149e954ffcb0a4bacc25d463fd"><span data-offset-key="796db4149e954ffcb0a4bacc25d463fd:0">node command-line options documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="cad846623d8f4d16a11543789c78bccc"><span offset-key="cad846623d8f4d16a11543789c78bccc:0"> for more information.</span></span>

# 

<span key="18a026a155314e50abf9eec47f3abd77"><span offset-key="18a026a155314e50abf9eec47f3abd77:0">Do logging correctly</span></span>

<span key="304090f2f03b4e2da58098037a2978c7"><span offset-key="304090f2f03b4e2da58098037a2978c7:0">In general, there are two reasons for logging from your app: For debugging and for logging app activity (essentially, everything else). Using </span>`console.log()`<span offset-key="304090f2f03b4e2da58098037a2978c7:2"> or </span>`console.error()`<span offset-key="304090f2f03b4e2da58098037a2978c7:4"> to print log messages to the terminal is common practice in development. But </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org/api/console.html#console_console_1" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="569e6404443c4e57aa75658fa1c6a6cf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="d2ac5b1b45b44d2cbc9f935cb8705368"><span data-offset-key="d2ac5b1b45b44d2cbc9f935cb8705368:0">these functions are synchronous</span></span></span></a><span key="13a48654c2b44ef39a0829586402926d"><span offset-key="13a48654c2b44ef39a0829586402926d:0"> when the destination is a terminal or a file, so they are not suitable for production, unless you pipe the output to another program.</span></span>

## 

<span key="ee35becdf5ba47d0bf197d388d0b1af6"><span offset-key="ee35becdf5ba47d0bf197d388d0b1af6:0">For debugging</span></span>

<span key="e9d5d0940cdc4b789c1bb6cf070194a4"><span offset-key="e9d5d0940cdc4b789c1bb6cf070194a4:0">If you’re logging for purposes of debugging, then instead of using </span>`console.log()`<span offset-key="e9d5d0940cdc4b789c1bb6cf070194a4:2">, use a special debugging module like </span></span><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/debug" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a3568f689f9046f79b4dda6ed15da8aa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="598be99b02cb4709992dba228bb53f5c"><span data-offset-key="598be99b02cb4709992dba228bb53f5c:0">debug</span></span></span></a><span key="34d11b929f9d4e07ae48b00c32ac3fa3"><span offset-key="34d11b929f9d4e07ae48b00c32ac3fa3:0">. This module enables you to use the DEBUG environment variable to control what debug messages are sent to </span>`console.error()`<span offset-key="34d11b929f9d4e07ae48b00c32ac3fa3:2">, if any. To keep your app purely asynchronous, you’d still want to pipe </span>`console.error()`<span offset-key="34d11b929f9d4e07ae48b00c32ac3fa3:4"> to another program. But then, you’re not really going to debug in production, are you?</span></span>

## 

<span key="dc74c3472df746a09f8f9f12585c174f"><span offset-key="dc74c3472df746a09f8f9f12585c174f:0">For app activity</span></span>

<span key="83438cdc6cfd4313882d29df0716114d"><span offset-key="83438cdc6cfd4313882d29df0716114d:0">If you’re logging app activity (for example, tracking traffic or API calls), instead of using </span>`console.log()`<span offset-key="83438cdc6cfd4313882d29df0716114d:2">, use a logging library like </span></span><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/winston" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0cdbbd088feb4936ba7c6c6d11928baf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="b681e201556c4d189229734cec8a3371"><span data-offset-key="b681e201556c4d189229734cec8a3371:0">Winston</span></span></span></a><span key="a1a8e4d29ac24338bf8a1d0d5b7f259a"><span offset-key="a1a8e4d29ac24338bf8a1d0d5b7f259a:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/bunyan" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="50bb5d9151db482cab35f314f388e6a0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="d4eb6cb9035341b09e44df0ae4737e7a"><span data-offset-key="d4eb6cb9035341b09e44df0ae4737e7a:0">Bunyan</span></span></span></a><span key="a8e729d6ccf0450798a7c848a90eb397"><span offset-key="a8e729d6ccf0450798a7c848a90eb397:0">. For a detailed comparison of these two libraries, see the StrongLoop blog post </span></span><a href="https://strongloop.com/strongblog/compare-node-js-logging-winston-bunyan/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="982ff84d3c03487dad882204bde64885" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="e228340afab1406ebbdc5d6c3925e5b8"><span data-offset-key="e228340afab1406ebbdc5d6c3925e5b8:0">Comparing Winston and Bunyan Node.js Logging</span></span></span></a><span key="d55a9424b3e24ee5955597e5e6d882a9"><span offset-key="d55a9424b3e24ee5955597e5e6d882a9:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="c69e360c59a1463887ec8b4328da2fbc"><span offset-key="c69e360c59a1463887ec8b4328da2fbc:0">Handle exceptions properly</span></span>

<span key="204aaed7a4df4b94ba459250a6323c30"><span offset-key="204aaed7a4df4b94ba459250a6323c30:0">Node apps crash when they encounter an uncaught exception. Not handling exceptions and taking appropriate actions will make your Express app crash and go offline. If you follow the advice in </span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#ensure-your-app-automatically-restarts" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5b590431483441f884cafe6917b0aa36" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="2f09b51a6c734f198fb29921034c644e"><span data-offset-key="2f09b51a6c734f198fb29921034c644e:0">Ensure your app automatically restarts</span></span></span></a><span key="309b9e3c26764ea3b7f3ac21bb541575"><span offset-key="309b9e3c26764ea3b7f3ac21bb541575:0"> below, then your app will recover from a crash. Fortunately, Express apps typically have a short startup time. Nevertheless, you want to avoid crashing in the first place, and to do that, you need to handle exceptions properly.</span></span>

<span key="dda785c8431a48e1b3bbd01966d28938"><span offset-key="dda785c8431a48e1b3bbd01966d28938:0">To ensure you handle all exceptions, use the following techniques:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b5e2fa9e19344ccbb70720b77fe8c0a3"><span offset-key="b5e2fa9e19344ccbb70720b77fe8c0a3:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#use-try-catch" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7376689f55ec45b0b75ff6c910e389fe" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="8572174220154c23a396c9db4ba82612"><span data-offset-key="8572174220154c23a396c9db4ba82612:0">Use try-catch</span></span></span></a><span key="d467c1320ddf4730b213035a437fa29a"><span offset-key="d467c1320ddf4730b213035a437fa29a:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0490957b4d9f48b1b237013dc23a48fe"><span offset-key="0490957b4d9f48b1b237013dc23a48fe:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#use-promises" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="271ff2ae2aaa4793843f73ede3061735" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="0db008c63df34442906259b0ec0596f2"><span data-offset-key="0db008c63df34442906259b0ec0596f2:0">Use promises</span></span></span></a><span key="24b8d4407c7743ea950f06b710948159"><span offset-key="24b8d4407c7743ea950f06b710948159:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="5c185cd7f204470c83f3ba376e6b0cd6"><span offset-key="5c185cd7f204470c83f3ba376e6b0cd6:0">Before diving into these topics, you should have a basic understanding of Node/Express error handling: using error-first callbacks, and propagating errors in middleware. Node uses an “error-first callback” convention for returning errors from asynchronous functions, where the first parameter to the callback function is the error object, followed by result data in succeeding parameters. To indicate no error, pass null as the first parameter. The callback function must correspondingly follow the error-first callback convention to meaningfully handle the error. And in Express, the best practice is to use the next() function to propagate errors through the middleware chain.</span></span>

<span key="201e4111c7fb4164b33acc7f3719cb53"><span offset-key="201e4111c7fb4164b33acc7f3719cb53:0">For more on the fundamentals of error handling, see:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a5836a70bed24ad9b658d701e68a3c87"><span offset-key="a5836a70bed24ad9b658d701e68a3c87:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.joyent.com/developers/node/design/errors" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5c979dc0684f4c9282463fefd0e69350" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="0d774961d58148368009131a1c3974a8"><span data-offset-key="0d774961d58148368009131a1c3974a8:0">Error Handling in Node.js</span></span></span></a><span key="010825101a6249889168caa46be44972"><span offset-key="010825101a6249889168caa46be44972:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5cc28afa29404b6ba09effce0f78b3a9"><span offset-key="5cc28afa29404b6ba09effce0f78b3a9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://strongloop.com/strongblog/robust-node-applications-error-handling/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="aaa5e2f4635f4fd3ad83065384c62122" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="7b0770e6ab694f77be2b56cd5cfd4ad0"><span data-offset-key="7b0770e6ab694f77be2b56cd5cfd4ad0:0">Building Robust Node Applications: Error Handling</span></span></span></a><span key="dbcb232c8e6f481d9d5e9f1ff02073cf"><span offset-key="dbcb232c8e6f481d9d5e9f1ff02073cf:0"> (StrongLoop blog)</span></span>

## 

<span key="3d95d4ec574046378de9866025b0f81f"><span offset-key="3d95d4ec574046378de9866025b0f81f:0">What not to do</span></span>

<span key="c8cbf90429d5434b9f9508b07408ccf3"><span offset-key="c8cbf90429d5434b9f9508b07408ccf3:0">One thing you should </span>*not*<span offset-key="c8cbf90429d5434b9f9508b07408ccf3:2"> do is to listen for the </span>`uncaughtException`<span offset-key="c8cbf90429d5434b9f9508b07408ccf3:4"> event, emitted when an exception bubbles all the way back to the event loop. Adding an event listener for </span>`uncaughtException`<span offset-key="c8cbf90429d5434b9f9508b07408ccf3:6"> will change the default behavior of the process that is encountering an exception; the process will continue to run despite the exception. This might sound like a good way of preventing your app from crashing, but continuing to run the app after an uncaught exception is a dangerous practice and is not recommended, because the state of the process becomes unreliable and unpredictable.</span></span>

<span key="e0e82b9dad4f4d07b3fc41ae0dc2c7d3"><span offset-key="e0e82b9dad4f4d07b3fc41ae0dc2c7d3:0">Additionally, using </span>`uncaughtException`<span offset-key="e0e82b9dad4f4d07b3fc41ae0dc2c7d3:2"> is officially recognized as </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#process_event_uncaughtexception" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3f6815b072124d279e9fcc68886306e8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="8dc3dd126a5e460aa69c7192208d1470"><span data-offset-key="8dc3dd126a5e460aa69c7192208d1470:0">crude</span></span></span></a><span key="4de6bf628d374227b4c88f306a217c36"><span offset-key="4de6bf628d374227b4c88f306a217c36:0">. So listening for </span>`uncaughtException`<span offset-key="4de6bf628d374227b4c88f306a217c36:2"> is just a bad idea. This is why we recommend things like multiple processes and supervisors: crashing and restarting is often the most reliable way to recover from an error.</span></span>

<span key="f082498f17d54178a96e5cb3beccb6e6"><span offset-key="f082498f17d54178a96e5cb3beccb6e6:0">We also don’t recommend using </span></span><a href="https://nodejs.org/api/domain.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8e5054ee0b414aa380cfacd503cd32da" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="047e6f5f5a9f434f8efe70d33f958c94"><span data-offset-key="047e6f5f5a9f434f8efe70d33f958c94:0">domains</span></span></span></a><span key="9621ec668d0d45aaa099eac4f5f5918d"><span offset-key="9621ec668d0d45aaa099eac4f5f5918d:0">. It generally doesn’t solve the problem and is a deprecated module.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2770f11ac74b42f69a3bfb15466bd8ce"><span offset-key="2770f11ac74b42f69a3bfb15466bd8ce:0">Use try-catch</span></span>

<span key="66c46d449b3240f0a4d8fb60d1011064"><span offset-key="66c46d449b3240f0a4d8fb60d1011064:0">Try-catch is a JavaScript language construct that you can use to catch exceptions in synchronous code. Use try-catch, for example, to handle JSON parsing errors as shown below.</span></span>

<span key="741e69467d5242e885e605e130e37d39"><span offset-key="741e69467d5242e885e605e130e37d39:0">Use a tool such as </span></span><a href="http://jshint.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="59d655fd966e44c6895894014e13c0a9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="25bc35e3d2d54f449ec72c86b755a4f4"><span data-offset-key="25bc35e3d2d54f449ec72c86b755a4f4:0">JSHint</span></span></span></a><span key="c8971463c77749699c67100b9736bf24"><span offset-key="c8971463c77749699c67100b9736bf24:0"> or </span></span><a href="http://www.jslint.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7b1450f5eb224042a57aed91183ac493" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="a49a3f2559154e75854f1e41db806ca5"><span data-offset-key="a49a3f2559154e75854f1e41db806ca5:0">JSLint</span></span></span></a><span key="8642a89f9ec049bdbfd48a8a1ecb26e0"><span offset-key="8642a89f9ec049bdbfd48a8a1ecb26e0:0"> to help you find implicit exceptions like </span></span><a href="http://www.jshint.com/docs/options/#undef" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4abc31c79e394242a1d8182c76a81b4b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="123e74b4ac0a4791883d04df2260fdb2"><span data-offset-key="123e74b4ac0a4791883d04df2260fdb2:0">reference errors on undefined variables</span></span></span></a><span key="02ba97e1a6aa4dc895c84322b658c836"><span offset-key="02ba97e1a6aa4dc895c84322b658c836:0">.</span></span>

<span key="20e825ca8ad141f09a1f935c021afd30"><span offset-key="20e825ca8ad141f09a1f935c021afd30:0">Here is an example of using try-catch to handle a potential process-crashing exception. This middleware function accepts a query field parameter named “params” that is a JSON object.</span></span>

1

<span key="187919a6b40d4f1bb89ded7a44850a20"><span offset-key="187919a6b40d4f1bb89ded7a44850a20:0">app.get('/search', function (req, res) {</span></span>

2

<span key="a7bbbc2d223d42779d0cd0f9d65a6492"><span offset-key="a7bbbc2d223d42779d0cd0f9d65a6492:0"> // Simulating async operation</span></span>

3

<span key="e6dee3da326a4e5a9d9fa37a5b23a80e"><span offset-key="e6dee3da326a4e5a9d9fa37a5b23a80e:0"> setImmediate(function () {</span></span>

4

<span key="93ab084fe29948c091d57ab5670c5708"><span offset-key="93ab084fe29948c091d57ab5670c5708:0"> var jsonStr = req.query.params</span></span>

5

<span key="195c92a71a194947b4dc911d3f9bb783"><span offset-key="195c92a71a194947b4dc911d3f9bb783:0"> try {</span></span>

6

<span key="3ae804d59d5a4dff8dc236ea7be03987"><span offset-key="3ae804d59d5a4dff8dc236ea7be03987:0"> var jsonObj = JSON.parse(jsonStr)</span></span>

7

<span key="2a3fa367ba8a416699a8c5ce9afa6940"><span offset-key="2a3fa367ba8a416699a8c5ce9afa6940:0"> res.send('Success')</span></span>

8

<span key="266c42b8031648d5a355aeca71667108"><span offset-key="266c42b8031648d5a355aeca71667108:0"> } catch (e) {</span></span>

9

<span key="aebdf2b93f624133b260ed6c77bc8dfd"><span offset-key="aebdf2b93f624133b260ed6c77bc8dfd:0"> res.status(400).send('Invalid JSON string')</span></span>

10

<span key="8095f99cad124c998757a47ad9d4f6a5"><span offset-key="8095f99cad124c998757a47ad9d4f6a5:0"> }</span></span>

11

<span key="af420421e2c84f51b10be81e1e6f847d"><span offset-key="af420421e2c84f51b10be81e1e6f847d:0"> })</span></span>

12

<span key="e66a54d3e5ed45e3a73cde2eff1b394d"><span offset-key="e66a54d3e5ed45e3a73cde2eff1b394d:0">})</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="ac22e76efb9540c8ade4bed90a7f0617"><span offset-key="ac22e76efb9540c8ade4bed90a7f0617:0">However, try-catch works only for synchronous code. Because the Node platform is primarily asynchronous (particularly in a production environment), try-catch won’t catch a lot of exceptions.</span></span>

## 

<span key="1342d30da5f5461d8db297a0ea923c7a"><span offset-key="1342d30da5f5461d8db297a0ea923c7a:0">Use promises</span></span>

<span key="88cbbe529031458d9aa1bd7e4b15b66d"><span offset-key="88cbbe529031458d9aa1bd7e4b15b66d:0">Promises will handle any exceptions (both explicit and implicit) in asynchronous code blocks that use </span>`then()`<span offset-key="88cbbe529031458d9aa1bd7e4b15b66d:2">. Just add </span>`.catch(next)`<span offset-key="88cbbe529031458d9aa1bd7e4b15b66d:4"> to the end of promise chains. For example:</span></span>

1

<span key="cb0829a09f2c40c5bee9b4d4aabab641"><span offset-key="cb0829a09f2c40c5bee9b4d4aabab641:0">app.get('/', function (req, res, next) {</span></span>

2

<span key="65d7a6e82fa3435fb9120d9e2f4d4c4a"><span offset-key="65d7a6e82fa3435fb9120d9e2f4d4c4a:0"> // do some sync stuff</span></span>

3

<span key="cfe65c6c61dc4ecf8957c421cc059865"><span offset-key="cfe65c6c61dc4ecf8957c421cc059865:0"> queryDb()</span></span>

4

<span key="c234be87c3494ecb9b1f57c5e060156a"><span offset-key="c234be87c3494ecb9b1f57c5e060156a:0"> .then(function (data) {</span></span>

5

<span key="dce448d7a6c94701a11a353feabb169e"><span offset-key="dce448d7a6c94701a11a353feabb169e:0"> // handle data</span></span>

6

<span key="7656e6b27f9a4ebc85c4f19ad6c3c2d1"><span offset-key="7656e6b27f9a4ebc85c4f19ad6c3c2d1:0"> return makeCsv(data)</span></span>

7

<span key="156a45b166ac4a69a8cce76a6404c861"><span offset-key="156a45b166ac4a69a8cce76a6404c861:0"> })</span></span>

8

<span key="099e70b8bf054d71917d46a5d6619fad"><span offset-key="099e70b8bf054d71917d46a5d6619fad:0"> .then(function (csv) {</span></span>

9

<span key="19d9593021274dac84b16b45109bde71"><span offset-key="19d9593021274dac84b16b45109bde71:0"> // handle csv</span></span>

10

<span key="59b533c6f8624bcb8a4ab38d61208e37"><span offset-key="59b533c6f8624bcb8a4ab38d61208e37:0"> })</span></span>

11

<span key="6a93d97bab284beaba63e123148b54d3"><span offset-key="6a93d97bab284beaba63e123148b54d3:0"> .catch(next)</span></span>

12

<span key="d792281c8ec04250b66811219a53d38a"><span offset-key="d792281c8ec04250b66811219a53d38a:0">})app.use(function (err, req, res, next) {</span></span>

13

<span key="7666b44703f84f2b832765e188e05c34"><span offset-key="7666b44703f84f2b832765e188e05c34:0"> // handle error</span></span>

14

<span key="3026e53f9d034c4684915f45aa88203e"><span offset-key="3026e53f9d034c4684915f45aa88203e:0">})</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="fb27df688c3f4f94b14489b3d5e0f0f5"><span offset-key="fb27df688c3f4f94b14489b3d5e0f0f5:0">Now all errors asynchronous and synchronous get propagated to the error middleware.</span></span>

<span key="67a08ebdf1574d6288ea7d0da5f3d8f4"><span offset-key="67a08ebdf1574d6288ea7d0da5f3d8f4:0">However, there are two caveats:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">1.</span>
    <span key="f0df9a38a157444c93196edaef6a68e8"><span offset-key="f0df9a38a157444c93196edaef6a68e8:0">All your asynchronous code must return promises (except emitters). If a particular library does not return promises, convert the base object by using a helper function like </span></span><a href="http://bluebirdjs.com/docs/api/promise.promisifyall.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b1229dab52c9484d8ad0a5c6a4217383" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="63e124c4b41046fb81eff77d3d7058d5"><span data-offset-key="63e124c4b41046fb81eff77d3d7058d5:0">Bluebird.promisifyAll()</span></span></span></a><span key="1020394c43b8419abac6d8283cc8fcd8"><span offset-key="1020394c43b8419abac6d8283cc8fcd8:0">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">2.</span>
    <span key="e93c30c3bc3e4337b4944f6e0bdb56a1"><span offset-key="e93c30c3bc3e4337b4944f6e0bdb56a1:0">Event emitters (like streams) can still cause uncaught exceptions. So make sure you are handling the error event properly; for example:</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">3.</span>
    <span key="71f197a0367f490aac94fd33861ee62b"><span offset-key="71f197a0367f490aac94fd33861ee62b:0">const wrap = fn => (…args) => fn(…args).catch(args\[2\])</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height: 24px">4.</span>
    <span key="2dea2cb4c3a44e539aabe01bb3d937b4"><span offset-key="2dea2cb4c3a44e539aabe01bb3d937b4:0">app.get(‘/’, wrap(async (req, res, next) => { const company = await getCompanyById(</span></span><a href="http://req.query.id" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c22d3b01b2b84f999e6f90bdccd55d00" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="35418a7562b34de4b05822ee6df15b49"><span data-offset-key="35418a7562b34de4b05822ee6df15b49:0">req.query.id</span></span></span></a><span key="e954961f1037433f9aa2320bc44156bd"><span offset-key="e954961f1037433f9aa2320bc44156bd:0">) const stream = getLogoStreamById(</span></span><a href="http://company.id" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="dcfd8ae821074ffd9acfcc2c8d052e1b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="d67902deec0d430ca34f67218ab8f4ba"><span data-offset-key="d67902deec0d430ca34f67218ab8f4ba:0">company.id</span></span></span></a><span key="99ac2fc7b3074aa896bd821194dc4bfc"><span offset-key="99ac2fc7b3074aa896bd821194dc4bfc:0">) stream.on(‘error’, next).pipe(res) }))</span></span>

<span key="75dd412fc1314f9297984acf975e776a"><span offset-key="75dd412fc1314f9297984acf975e776a:0">The </span>`wrap()`<span offset-key="75dd412fc1314f9297984acf975e776a:2"> function is a wrapper that catches rejected promises and calls </span>`next()`<span offset-key="75dd412fc1314f9297984acf975e776a:4"> with the error as the first argument. For details, see </span></span><a href="https://strongloop.com/strongblog/async-error-handling-expressjs-es7-promises-generators/#cleaner-code-with-generators" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="68d0fffab45b4e7b8294f958fded51b1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="ed80633eaebc47c8910ef6faed8d2089"><span data-offset-key="ed80633eaebc47c8910ef6faed8d2089:0">Asynchronous Error Handling in Express with Promises, Generators and ES7</span></span></span></a><span key="f1207d661353474a806e2821710038e6"><span offset-key="f1207d661353474a806e2821710038e6:0">.</span></span>

<span key="a111e72f9ce945819d52313740896b75"><span offset-key="a111e72f9ce945819d52313740896b75:0">For more information about error-handling by using promises, see </span></span><a href="https://strongloop.com/strongblog/promises-in-node-js-with-q-an-alternative-to-callbacks/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ea4da925e1e848f9930731d5eae895fb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="235b71241e054c3b86a78f8006c5a02c"><span data-offset-key="235b71241e054c3b86a78f8006c5a02c:0">Promises in Node.js with Q — An Alternative to Callbacks</span></span></span></a><span key="fc77d87cd06240b481c962fe8de79455"><span offset-key="fc77d87cd06240b481c962fe8de79455:0">.</span></span>

<span key="940bba00f61747bcb8ac99fcc9903f2d"><span offset-key="940bba00f61747bcb8ac99fcc9903f2d:0">Here are some things you can do in your system environment to improve your app’s performance:</span></span>

    <span key="4b807cb3f1e844dea06950c59a1a363d"><span offset-key="4b807cb3f1e844dea06950c59a1a363d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#ensure-your-app-automatically-restarts" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e53e3487200a4dd188702ac2f490a21f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="a8d5017377d7423d8796167436faf714"><span data-offset-key="a8d5017377d7423d8796167436faf714:0">Ensure your app automatically restarts</span></span></span></a><span key="e1e8c832eefc4c6a8d24760273cfc5c3"><span offset-key="e1e8c832eefc4c6a8d24760273cfc5c3:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

    <span key="1dbd886d9f034d41afcffa992c00eb28"><span offset-key="1dbd886d9f034d41afcffa992c00eb28:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#run-your-app-in-a-cluster" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="75fc9816bd494d2da7dcf11360821755" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="0912ff0785ce4e159bd21994e83c8075"><span data-offset-key="0912ff0785ce4e159bd21994e83c8075:0">Run your app in a cluster</span></span></span></a><span key="6fa87ad579b543d6a298a772a01e44a9"><span offset-key="6fa87ad579b543d6a298a772a01e44a9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

    <span key="7dff09334b414ed19bad1068a51a645f"><span offset-key="7dff09334b414ed19bad1068a51a645f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#cache-request-results" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6ff3af7278184a149b02d4d7829a60f5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="4c480849bc5e4dac86b31f8dcc29797a"><span data-offset-key="4c480849bc5e4dac86b31f8dcc29797a:0">Cache request results</span></span></span></a><span key="4e55a7d32d0d47a59f015a33137ea0ac"><span offset-key="4e55a7d32d0d47a59f015a33137ea0ac:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

    <span key="5451e5d201dc4774bc6a65020f49a3d0"><span offset-key="5451e5d201dc4774bc6a65020f49a3d0:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#use-a-reverse-proxy" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9d2d1dd5c20543d2ba349bd265b2d776" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="4c578ce5973845279ccc08718ea793d9"><span data-offset-key="4c578ce5973845279ccc08718ea793d9:0">Use a reverse proxy</span></span></span></a><span key="627daa63e4e446bc9bb9539295c3c081"><span offset-key="627daa63e4e446bc9bb9539295c3c081:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

# 

<span key="7f9b27839bdb4a3eb9f6df176d8e2fb1"><span offset-key="7f9b27839bdb4a3eb9f6df176d8e2fb1:0">Set NODE\_ENV to “production”</span></span>

<span key="60e55f514b674475aa6f53a1ba707129"><span offset-key="60e55f514b674475aa6f53a1ba707129:0">The NODE\_ENV environment variable specifies the environment in which an application is running (usually, development or production). One of the simplest things you can do to improve performance is to set NODE\_ENV to “production.”</span></span>

<span key="b00e2499944f4f80a3438b891b029449"><span offset-key="b00e2499944f4f80a3438b891b029449:0">Setting NODE\_ENV to “production” makes Express:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="bdf37c7d2b924d92be4acf182e316b41"><span offset-key="bdf37c7d2b924d92be4acf182e316b41:0">Cache view templates.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ebf2f59e36cd4568a6dcbcf7ecf5ac37"><span offset-key="ebf2f59e36cd4568a6dcbcf7ecf5ac37:0">Cache CSS files generated from CSS extensions.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="489a7c0464324a01acd7cbe9604d427e"><span offset-key="489a7c0464324a01acd7cbe9604d427e:0">Generate less verbose error messages.</span></span>

<span key="29a540fe52bd439688809e7a466bae24"><span offset-key="29a540fe52bd439688809e7a466bae24:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="http://apmblog.dynatrace.com/2015/07/22/the-drastic-effects-of-omitting-node_env-in-your-express-js-applications/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b853bb70c3df433eb22bb4be52c9db38" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="47d7903e76ab4914904ae5e2f192331b"><span data-offset-key="47d7903e76ab4914904ae5e2f192331b:0">Tests indicate</span></span></span></a><span key="102f9dcea612442797e646a15f21bc18"><span offset-key="102f9dcea612442797e646a15f21bc18:0"> that just doing this can improve app performance by a factor of three!</span></span>

<span key="930e93862a58492a8f70154934b3db0e"><span offset-key="930e93862a58492a8f70154934b3db0e:0">If you need to write environment-specific code, you can check the value of NODE\_ENV with </span>`process.env.NODE_ENV`<span offset-key="930e93862a58492a8f70154934b3db0e:2">. Be aware that checking the value of any environment variable incurs a performance penalty, and so should be done sparingly.</span></span>

<span key="ccab9b5e231e453db287f34d79b1b130"><span offset-key="ccab9b5e231e453db287f34d79b1b130:0">In development, you typically set environment variables in your interactive shell, for example by using </span>`export`<span offset-key="ccab9b5e231e453db287f34d79b1b130:2"> or your </span>`.bash_profile`<span offset-key="ccab9b5e231e453db287f34d79b1b130:4"> file. But in general you shouldn’t do that on a production server; instead, use your OS’s init system (systemd or Upstart). The next section provides more details about using your init system in general, but setting NODE\_ENV is so important for performance (and easy to do), that it’s highlighted here.</span></span>

<span key="6bc7c430dbc34df39032c0d625fd45b4"><span offset-key="6bc7c430dbc34df39032c0d625fd45b4:0">With Upstart, use the </span>`env`<span offset-key="6bc7c430dbc34df39032c0d625fd45b4:2"> keyword in your job file. For example:</span></span>

1

<span key="d341eef2f0804990a9a9b81f70e9af61"><span offset-key="d341eef2f0804990a9a9b81f70e9af61:0"># /etc/init/env.conf</span></span>

2

<span key="51c066230a564ae9ae6a429b9c2c7fef"><span offset-key="51c066230a564ae9ae6a429b9c2c7fef:0"> env NODE\_ENV=production</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="25b64199fc7543a2bed4be3ac70ba518"><span offset-key="25b64199fc7543a2bed4be3ac70ba518:0">For more information, see the </span></span><a href="http://upstart.ubuntu.com/cookbook/#environment-variables" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="714f5d32b1664a9abc958732759247ba" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="1f71a801c7f249d586b0699cca74caf5"><span data-offset-key="1f71a801c7f249d586b0699cca74caf5:0">Upstart Intro, Cookbook and Best Practices</span></span></span></a><span key="5b443d3e639a413db88e5b556bef865b"><span offset-key="5b443d3e639a413db88e5b556bef865b:0">.</span></span>

<span key="f5b7250d810548ad92c2410871b73900"><span offset-key="f5b7250d810548ad92c2410871b73900:0">With systemd, use the </span>`Environment`<span offset-key="f5b7250d810548ad92c2410871b73900:2"> directive in your unit file. For example:</span></span>

1

<span key="ab5f83ef77bd4b94b7848d65c4cc6567"><span offset-key="ab5f83ef77bd4b94b7848d65c4cc6567:0"># /etc/systemd/system/myservice.service</span></span>

2

<span key="981a67d4ac9746af8c30d2090fb56860"><span offset-key="981a67d4ac9746af8c30d2090fb56860:0">Environment=NODE\_ENV=production</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="faadf9c2823641cc8099e968ea3a7886"><span offset-key="faadf9c2823641cc8099e968ea3a7886:0">For more information, see </span></span><a href="https://coreos.com/os/docs/latest/using-environment-variables-in-systemd-units.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8c56f014e1fd440fb0ef37c3f801b72b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="8572ef67890a40d095c3cc81b377bffe"><span data-offset-key="8572ef67890a40d095c3cc81b377bffe:0">Using Environment Variables In systemd Units</span></span></span></a><span key="025abd9b8aed4fa78d16e341fec39f6c"><span offset-key="025abd9b8aed4fa78d16e341fec39f6c:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="eb3acf43d62a44439420a38a3648b572"><span offset-key="eb3acf43d62a44439420a38a3648b572:0">Ensure your app automatically restarts</span></span>

<span key="106f701cb453439da0f9418ac4d50a95"><span offset-key="106f701cb453439da0f9418ac4d50a95:0">In production, you don’t want your application to be offline, ever. This means you need to make sure it restarts both if the app crashes and if the server itself crashes. Although you hope that neither of those events occurs, realistically you must account for both eventualities by:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="be6e7a154cd742f4b149713b3c9d7f95"><span offset-key="be6e7a154cd742f4b149713b3c9d7f95:0">Using a process manager to restart the app (and Node) when it crashes.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a2671f2bdd3f4bdba0141d93eec76e78"><span offset-key="a2671f2bdd3f4bdba0141d93eec76e78:0">Using the init system provided by your OS to restart the process manager when the OS crashes. It’s also possible to use the init system without a process manager.</span></span>

<span key="66a546dce65e4e63aa61b23dfea3180c"><span offset-key="66a546dce65e4e63aa61b23dfea3180c:0">Node applications crash if they encounter an uncaught exception. The foremost thing you need to do is to ensure your app is well-tested and handles all exceptions (see </span></span><a href="https://medium.com/codex/prerequisites-to-writing-express-apis-75e3267b284a#handle-exceptions-properly" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ad6307135d5042c190dc50f8c5bde976" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="c156c3986a3f4387af3d8de55ace7395"><span data-offset-key="c156c3986a3f4387af3d8de55ace7395:0">handle exceptions properly</span></span></span></a><span key="d69901fd6190475d8cbb3401a6bc1c4a"><span offset-key="d69901fd6190475d8cbb3401a6bc1c4a:0"> for details). But as a fail-safe, put a mechanism in place to ensure that if and when your app crashes, it will automatically restart.</span></span>

## 

<span key="225f2b9296dc40b69dcb5aa2775bf579"><span offset-key="225f2b9296dc40b69dcb5aa2775bf579:0">Use a process manager</span></span>

<span key="d32c4c67d45640c5bf4b385b56b9abf5"><span offset-key="d32c4c67d45640c5bf4b385b56b9abf5:0">In development, you started your app simply from the command line with </span>`node server.js`<span offset-key="d32c4c67d45640c5bf4b385b56b9abf5:2"> or something similar. But doing this in production is a recipe for disaster. If the app crashes, it will be offline until you restart it. To ensure your app restarts if it crashes, use a process manager. A process manager is a “container” for applications that facilitates deployment, provides high availability, and enables you to manage the application at runtime.</span></span>

<span key="4f77c72ebd7540e993b1e7d39e1cea5b"><span offset-key="4f77c72ebd7540e993b1e7d39e1cea5b:0">In addition to restarting your app when it crashes, a process manager can enable you to:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="20c5d441e1f94839b7ce8f6801fd117b"><span offset-key="20c5d441e1f94839b7ce8f6801fd117b:0">Gain insights into runtime performance and resource consumption.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="79d59f0d240d4ffb96d230877c453bf1"><span offset-key="79d59f0d240d4ffb96d230877c453bf1:0">Modify settings dynamically to improve performance.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="76e6d60a6b074192bb812b727a909ebf"><span offset-key="76e6d60a6b074192bb812b727a909ebf:0">Control clustering (StrongLoop PM and pm2).</span></span>

<span key="024078e5b2da4002998a6decac69536a"><span offset-key="024078e5b2da4002998a6decac69536a:0">The most popular process managers for Node are as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="159dc1614cd64b8ca2c7bd865d06ec00"><span offset-key="159dc1614cd64b8ca2c7bd865d06ec00:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="http://strong-pm.io" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ab91b88097e24267a9e829fbe7124963" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="f872a22e92c3488aba11e8765334026b"><span data-offset-key="f872a22e92c3488aba11e8765334026b:0">StrongLoop Process Manager</span></span></span></a><span key="763b6a0907e240ce99db06b4e74de5fc"><span offset-key="763b6a0907e240ce99db06b4e74de5fc:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2f6fd0455e7444288c70b87c3dc2a2e5"><span offset-key="2f6fd0455e7444288c70b87c3dc2a2e5:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://github.com/Unitech/pm2" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1b94b13514054e5aa95c4968aa871e04" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="d219a2a640784a25a80325e99371525e"><span data-offset-key="d219a2a640784a25a80325e99371525e:0">PM2</span></span></span></a><span key="5c34f846bff7484eb9c630bf8ec4092d"><span offset-key="5c34f846bff7484eb9c630bf8ec4092d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0c84946028a04ea19d262c68dfb1aae6"><span offset-key="0c84946028a04ea19d262c68dfb1aae6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/forever" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="569bfc3aa8c14ddda28cc12985ee7b43" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="5143ad08832949a4ad9ecd3a6c90b638"><span data-offset-key="5143ad08832949a4ad9ecd3a6c90b638:0">Forever</span></span></span></a><span key="894985789690428fb8a2dfd8e1676604"><span offset-key="894985789690428fb8a2dfd8e1676604:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="120b74f249394cc49cabf834b43264f6"><span offset-key="120b74f249394cc49cabf834b43264f6:0">For a feature-by-feature comparison of the three process managers, see </span></span><a href="http://strong-pm.io/compare/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7e117c6ac4fb4806b62a68f1c89bff5d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="6050412d6735415ebca719eb7a99891c"><span data-offset-key="6050412d6735415ebca719eb7a99891c:0">http://strong-pm.io/compare/</span></span></span></a><span key="9b0f455474be40ea8adadccc899356dd"><span offset-key="9b0f455474be40ea8adadccc899356dd:0">. For a more detailed introduction to all three, see </span></span><a href="https://medium.com/%7B%7B%20page.lang%20%7D%7D/advanced/pm.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5859ea299af044a687675068e9cba9fc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="638ac018938249db8d3f6c2d8eec5c92"><span data-offset-key="638ac018938249db8d3f6c2d8eec5c92:0">Process managers for Express apps</span></span></span></a><span key="7c14c96ade0d4e31b2e96cea012359e2"><span offset-key="7c14c96ade0d4e31b2e96cea012359e2:0">.</span></span>

<span key="70eafa22564b4a458420ca121e9b796f"><span offset-key="70eafa22564b4a458420ca121e9b796f:0">Using any of these process managers will suffice to keep your application up, even if it does crash from time to time.</span></span>

<span key="c92405068c5642858a5c8ea4d141b52c"><span offset-key="c92405068c5642858a5c8ea4d141b52c:0">However, StrongLoop PM has lots of features that specifically target production deployment. You can use it and the related StrongLoop tools to:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4b2ef6f7e6f04d36b1e150c897220477"><span offset-key="4b2ef6f7e6f04d36b1e150c897220477:0">Build and package your app locally, then deploy it securely to your production system.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d89c34b2611b4cb5b090649ba9238a12"><span offset-key="d89c34b2611b4cb5b090649ba9238a12:0">Automatically restart your app if it crashes for any reason.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5138172888274c8f88e8603f0b2be282"><span offset-key="5138172888274c8f88e8603f0b2be282:0">Manage your clusters remotely.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ad6ce50797524f9aaaf96ed89811915f"><span offset-key="ad6ce50797524f9aaaf96ed89811915f:0">View CPU profiles and heap snapshots to optimize performance and diagnose memory leaks.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fb53c4557a1b4a279a7f5910fb3a65e3"><span offset-key="fb53c4557a1b4a279a7f5910fb3a65e3:0">View performance metrics for your application.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="42071bbe08a546f69e1e685cecd3a997"><span offset-key="42071bbe08a546f69e1e685cecd3a997:0">Easily scale to multiple hosts with integrated control for Nginx load balancer.</span></span>

<span key="5dbeed4280514603bd5342a225d996bb"><span offset-key="5dbeed4280514603bd5342a225d996bb:0">As explained below, when you install StrongLoop PM as an operating system service using your init system, it will automatically restart when the system restarts. Thus, it will keep your application processes and clusters alive forever.</span></span>

# 

<span key="e207ca550db94f2baf9ff8565e0f60e7"><span offset-key="e207ca550db94f2baf9ff8565e0f60e7:0">Cache request results</span></span>

<span key="2f40ea3b5264463988045ed299d6f423"><span offset-key="2f40ea3b5264463988045ed299d6f423:0">Another strategy to improve the performance in production is to cache the result of requests, so that your app does not repeat the operation to serve the same request repeatedly.</span></span>

<span key="d76f4606e0b1480db1e2bf358b840983"><span offset-key="d76f4606e0b1480db1e2bf358b840983:0">Use a caching server like </span></span><a href="https://www.varnish-cache.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f3c54a6558b84431bad4a2f99f16ecc7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="43dea8a28fd744c4827e524f06f62066"><span data-offset-key="43dea8a28fd744c4827e524f06f62066:0">Varnish</span></span></span></a><span key="234d1dbc355a43fca63f1608bc05119e"><span offset-key="234d1dbc355a43fca63f1608bc05119e:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://www.nginx.com/resources/wiki/start/topics/examples/reverseproxycachingexample/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="755a985706d44e6bbc4fabfb55ef7f68" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="ac163f7099844335aeb49cf35cc37f88"><span data-offset-key="ac163f7099844335aeb49cf35cc37f88:0">Nginx</span></span></span></a><span key="e58d8a49001b48b68968c6ce9ffe7180"><span offset-key="e58d8a49001b48b68968c6ce9ffe7180:0"> (see also </span></span><a href="https://serversforhackers.com/nginx-caching/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f071042536fd4158b1cf3aa328e822d8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="1e4a5b54086045c496e2117ccda80964"><span data-offset-key="1e4a5b54086045c496e2117ccda80964:0">Nginx Caching</span></span></span></a><span key="49670c1a73514723b7b2863716e3a06c"><span offset-key="49670c1a73514723b7b2863716e3a06c:0">) to greatly improve the speed and performance of your app.</span></span>

# 

<span key="5bff93e8ae3f443a963c652799b0c2ae"><span offset-key="5bff93e8ae3f443a963c652799b0c2ae:0">Use a load balancer</span></span>

<span key="9a6b74adfe2849dab3d07963839eb5e3"><span offset-key="9a6b74adfe2849dab3d07963839eb5e3:0">No matter how optimized an app is, a single instance can handle only a limited amount of load and traffic. One way to scale an app is to run multiple instances of it and distribute the traffic via a load balancer. Setting up a load balancer can improve your app’s performance and speed, and enable it to scale more than is possible with a single instance.</span></span>

<span key="c00e5d85a10440849152ccee20a1f60a"><span offset-key="c00e5d85a10440849152ccee20a1f60a:0">A load balancer is usually a reverse proxy that orchestrates traffic to and from multiple application instances and servers. You can easily set up a load balancer for your app by using </span></span><a href="http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/load_balancing.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1e37831fe9fd4e84ba6d6191b362ff41" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="43647348bd784f9cb66c9805b161d900"><span data-offset-key="43647348bd784f9cb66c9805b161d900:0">Nginx</span></span></span></a><span key="0f7e782fc6224e88a8fe5a7f7ed5b8bf"><span offset-key="0f7e782fc6224e88a8fe5a7f7ed5b8bf:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/an-introduction-to-haproxy-and-load-balancing-concepts" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="059c215ac5c94ad0be91197d2c5a694d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="a45ff68029ca412ab763ff1c9dadc03d"><span data-offset-key="a45ff68029ca412ab763ff1c9dadc03d:0">HAProxy</span></span></span></a><span key="349d16af77a44a6d99989aa81c23d91e"><span offset-key="349d16af77a44a6d99989aa81c23d91e:0">.</span></span>

<span key="a5cf8fbf3a0c47d9aa3af66029cdbc5d"><span offset-key="a5cf8fbf3a0c47d9aa3af66029cdbc5d:0">With load balancing, you might have to ensure that requests that are associated with a particular session ID connect to the process that originated them. This is known as </span>*session affinity*<span offset-key="a5cf8fbf3a0c47d9aa3af66029cdbc5d:2">, or </span>*sticky sessions*<span offset-key="a5cf8fbf3a0c47d9aa3af66029cdbc5d:4">, and may be addressed by the suggestion above to use a data store such as Redis for session data (depending on your application). For a discussion, see </span></span><a href="http://socket.io/docs/using-multiple-nodes/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ab55d3345960459babfcaaeb53e793fa" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="7be0fc8832f7440cb3e9380d0e8f6df9"><span data-offset-key="7be0fc8832f7440cb3e9380d0e8f6df9:0">Using multiple nodes</span></span></span></a><span key="0177afac47cb45c6a7a28aa61316ef87"><span offset-key="0177afac47cb45c6a7a28aa61316ef87:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="b0403b44292d451ea98095416b0be0dd"><span offset-key="b0403b44292d451ea98095416b0be0dd:0">Use a reverse proxy</span></span>

<span key="2cf08cd956df4a8e95c0858e87fcfb6d"><span offset-key="2cf08cd956df4a8e95c0858e87fcfb6d:0">A reverse proxy sits in front of a web app and performs supporting operations on the requests, apart from directing requests to the app. It can handle error pages, compression, caching, serving files, and load balancing among other things.</span></span>

<span key="2b6b330529c54fcf8967dff09ab0a2eb"><span offset-key="2b6b330529c54fcf8967dff09ab0a2eb:0">Handing over tasks that do not require knowledge of application state to a reverse proxy frees up Express to perform specialized application tasks. For this reason, it is recommended to run Express behind a reverse proxy like </span></span><a href="https://www.nginx.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="56f6a586ef2e4cea86acd38116d0c671" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="9a8b32b7159a4045adcc66884effa6da"><span data-offset-key="9a8b32b7159a4045adcc66884effa6da:0">Nginx</span></span></span></a><span key="3b8e9b424e5f4a8d9939a1e5545c97c2"><span offset-key="3b8e9b424e5f4a8d9939a1e5545c97c2:0"> or </span></span><a href="http://www.haproxy.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d078463c7c1d42aa8c884a3e7ac91fd2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-62800_259-62801-237__"><span data-key="d34d52fb07284ae6b1d6eb4825612dc6"><span data-offset-key="d34d52fb07284ae6b1d6eb4825612dc6:0">HAProxy</span></span></span></a><span key="16cc43b67194491094f4feb5e4fcb687"><span offset-key="16cc43b67194491094f4feb5e4fcb687:0"> in production.</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-howw7u r-1vzi8xi" />
